alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN MASON, ROBERTSON, BRACKEN, SOUTH CENTRAL CLERMONT AND SOUTHWESTERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 238 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Augusta, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Augusta, Felicity, Brooksville, Dover, Higginsport, Germantown, Chilo, Willow Grove, Bradford, Stonewall, Powersville, Johnsville, Utopia, Chatham, Tuckahoe, Hittville, Minerva, US Route 62 at State Route 875 and Abigail. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
